title: Vassos Alexander
text:
Vassos Alexander is a British <a href="Sports%20journalism">sports reporter</a>, presenter, author and endurance runner. He is currently the sports presenter of "<a href="The%20Chris%20Evans%20Breakfast%20Show">The Chris Evans Breakfast Show</a>" on <a href="Virgin%20Radio">Virgin Radio</a>. Alexander hosts the <a href="Parkrun">Parkrun</a> podcast, he is a motivational speaker and serves as an ambassador for the young person's charity <a href="SkillForce">SkillForce</a>.
Broadcasting career.
From 2011, Alexander was the sports presenter on "<a href="The%20Chris%20Evans%20Breakfast%20Show">The Chris Evans Breakfast Show</a>" on <a href="BBC%20Radio%202">BBC Radio 2</a>. However, in January 2019, Alexander along with <a href="Chris%20Evans%20%28presenter%29">Chris Evans</a>, and several members of the BBC Radio 2 team moved to the Breakfast Show on Virgin Radio, where Alexander continues in his role as the sports reporter. During his time working with Evans, as well reporting sport, he has acted as a side kick presenter and shared his passion for running marathons with Evans, he has also authored two books on the subject.
He has also worked on <a href="Radio%205%20Live">Radio 5 Live</a> as a presenter, reported and commentated on <a href="BBC%20television">BBC television</a>, <a href="Channel%204">Channel 4</a>, <a href="BT%20Sport">BT Sport</a> and <a href="Eurosport">Eurosport</a>. He has reported on six <a href="Olympic%20Games">Olympic Games</a> for <a href="BBC%20Sport">BBC Sport</a> and currently commentates on <a href="tennis">tennis</a>, <a href="golf">golf</a>, <a href="Diving%20%28sport%29">diving</a> and <a href="darts">darts</a>.
Podcasts.
Since April 2018, Alexander has been the co-host of 'free weekly timed', a podcast on the global running phenomenon of <a href="Parkrun">Parkrun</a>. Alexander is a Parkrunner and co-hosts the <a href="http%3A//www.freeweeklytimed.com/">Free Weekly Timed</a> podcast with Helen Williams.
Running.
Alexander has completed some of the hardest <a href="Ultramarathon">ultra-marathons</a> in the sport including the 153-mile Spartathalon and ironman triathlons. He has also run over 50 road marathons and has a sub-3-hour personal best.

Personal life.
Alexander lives in <a href="Barnes%2C%20London">Barnes, south-west London</a> with his wife and three children (Matt, Mary and Emily).
